messages.subject: Re: Movies vs books
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/1/2003 9:43:17 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... The other big thing he added was the scene with the Bad Boys playing mailbox baseball. King
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/1/2003 9:43:17 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> <<Stand By Me. Also directed by Rob Reiner, from Stephen King's short story.
>
> >>
>
> But I learned from the special features on the DVD that he changed the main
>
> protagonist some. The scene with the gun was transferred from one
> character
> to another.
>
>

The other big thing he added was the scene with the Bad Boys playing mailbox
baseball. King loved it, and said he wished he'd thought of it.

Kathryn, who in one of her few brushes with greatness, once spent several
hours with Stephen King as he signed books at a bookstore I was working at.
Then a couple years later I got to spend an entire afternoon with his wife
Tabitha when she came to sign at the bookstore I owned. Come to think of it,
Sandra really reminds me of Tabitha King...


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
